Class dominoes.Bone 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dominoes.Bone
public class Bone
extends Object
This class represents a single domino or bone in the domino game. It consists of an ordered pair of integers, one on the left, and one on the right.

Bone(int, int)
Create a bone with two integers.

equals(Bone)
Determine if two bones are equal.
flip()
Flip the left and right numbers on the bone.
left()
Return the left number on this bone.
right()
Return the right number on this bone
weight()
Return the weight of the bone, which is the sum of the two numbers on the bone.

Bone 
  public Bone(int a,
              int b)
Create a bone with two integers. Assign the left element to the maximum of the two integers, and the right the minimum.

left 
  public int left()
Return the left number on this bone.
Returns:
the number on the left of the bone
right 
  public int right()
Return the right number on this bone
Returns:
the number on the right of this bone
weight 
  public int weight()
Return the weight of the bone, which is the sum of the two numbers on the bone.
Returns:
the sum of the left and the right of the bone
equals 
  public boolean equals(Bone b)
Determine if two bones are equal. Two bones are equal if they have the same numbers on the bone.
Returns:
true if the bones are equal, false otherwise
flip 
  public void flip()
Flip the left and right numbers on the bone.
